definitions.definition: the external form or appearance characteristic of someone or something; the outline of an area or figure.
examples: she liked the shape of his nose
synonyms: profile "the shape of the dining table"

definitions.definition: a person or thing that is difficult to see and identify clearly.
examples: he saw a shape through the mist

definitions.definition: a specific form or guise assumed by someone or something.
synonyms: image "a spirit in the shape of a fox"

definitions.definition: a piece of material, paper, etc., made or cut in a particular form.
examples: stick paper shapes on for the puppet's eyes and nose

definitions.definition: the particular condition or state of someone or something.
examples: he was in no shape to drive

definitions.definition: the distinctive nature or qualities of something.
examples: the future shape and direction of the country
check that your structure will give shape to your essay

definitions.definition: give a particular shape or form to.
examples: most caves are shaped by the flow of water through limestone
synonyms: whittle "the metal is shaped into tools"

definitions.definition: make (something) fit the form of something else.
examples: suits have been shaped to fit so snugly that no curve is undefined

definitions.definition: determine the nature of; have a great influence on.
examples: his childhood was shaped by a loving relationship with his elder brother
synonyms: affect "attitudes were shaped by his report"

definitions.definition: develop in a particular way; progress.
examples: the yacht was shaping well in trials
synonyms: come along "her work is shaping up nicely"

definitions.definition: form or produce (a sound or words).
